GOD.content: God of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, not the God of philosophers of ontotheology, but one who interrupts & retracts his order
GOD.linkedContent: God of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, not the God of philosophers of ontotheology, but one who interrupts & retracts his order

GOD.content: Abraham’s silence, secrecy of unforgivable, decision, would have “to be forgiven by the one he obeyed”
GOD.linkedContent: Abraham’s silence, secrecy of unforgivable, decision, would have “to be forgiven by the one he obeyed”

GOD.content: Judaic God repents, feels remorse, takes back his commands—i.e. the flood, his gesture resembles a confession, a plea for forgiveness [Christ is constantly taking back?]
GOD.linkedContent: Judaic God repents, feels remorse, takes back his commands—i.e. the flood, his gesture resembles a confession, a plea for forgiveness [Christ is constantly taking back?]

LOBL.content: je m’arrête > “same interdiction encrypts the resurrection at the moment when he sees the terrible Chose”
LOBL.linkedContent: je m’arrête > “same interdiction encrypts the resurrection at the moment when he sees the terrible Chose”

LOBL.content: terribleness of la chose, not only ineffable, unnarratable: it’s interdictory, it forbids telling/seeing
LOBL.linkedContent: terribleness of la chose, not only ineffable, unnarratable: it’s interdictory, it forbids telling/seeing

LOBL.content: interdiction violated by itself, sets in motion a single pas, overflows impossible récit, that which forbids happens [French? arriver?]
LOBL.linkedContent: interdiction violated by itself, sets in motion a single pas, overflows impossible récit, that which forbids happens [French? arriver?]

HASD.content: [in Christian apophatics of Dionysus] cause, gift of gift, order and promise are the same
HASD.linkedContent: [in Christian apophatics of Dionysus] cause, gift of gift, order and promise are the same

HASD.content: order or promise, injunction commits (me) to sign, in a rigorously asymmetrical manner, to reappropriate for myself and restore the symmetry
HASD.linkedContent: order or promise, injunction commits (me) to sign, in a rigorously asymmetrical manner, to reappropriate for myself and restore the symmetry

HASD.content: to deny, elude responsibility, it’s still necessary that I countersign it
HASD.linkedContent: to deny, elude responsibility, it’s still necessary that I countersign it

MPM.content: [re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)
MPM.linkedContent: [re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)

POOF.content: in Aristotle, honor saves friendship from calculation, from the market—still, it’s proportioned via hierarchy, a hierarchy as sacralization of the beginning, qua command (arkhé)
POOF.linkedContent: in Aristotle, honor saves friendship from calculation, from the market—still, it’s proportioned via hierarchy, a hierarchy as sacralization of the beginning, qua command (arkhé)

A.content: absolute arrivant, no more commands than commanded by memory of originary event where archaic is bound to final extremity (telos, eskhaton)
A.linkedContent: absolute arrivant, no more commands than commanded by memory of originary event where archaic is bound to final extremity (telos, eskhaton)

A.content: request for foundation or for condition of possibility speaks language of methodic order: 1) an order as in a whole 2) an order as in a sequence 3) an order as in a command
A.linkedContent: request for foundation or for condition of possibility speaks language of methodic order: 1) an order as in a whole 2) an order as in a sequence 3) an order as in a command

VM.content: Levinas’ critique of state’s alienation neither Marxist, nor Hegelian, nor anarchist, since his is a philosophy of “principle as commandment”
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ critique of state’s alienation neither Marxist, nor Hegelian, nor anarchist, since his is a philosophy of “principle as commandment”

PP.content: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle, prescribes silent cipher, signifies, orders autoscopy, autognosis [re: Socrates’ send-off of myths]
PP.linkedContent: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle, prescribes silent cipher, signifies, orders autoscopy, autognosis [re: Socrates’ send-off of myths]

PP.content: certain voice, command of logos that Socrates obeys > forbids more than it bids (qui interdit plutôt qu’elle ne dicte)
PP.linkedContent: certain voice, command of logos that Socrates obeys > forbids more than it bids (qui interdit plutôt qu’elle ne dicte)

OH.content: Europe: representation or figure of a universal idea; has confused its face, figure, w/ a point, a phallus; the idea of an advanced point of exemplarity is the idea of the European idea, eidos, archē, telos, the idea of beginning, commanding, cap, captain, towards an accomplished end
OH.linkedContent: Europe: representation or figure of a universal idea; has confused its face, figure, w/ a point, a phallus; the idea of an advanced point of exemplarity is the idea of the European idea, eidos, archē, telos, the idea of beginning, commanding, cap, captain, towards an accomplished end

OH.content: advanced point is at once beginning and end, divided as beginning and end (Heidegger on Ort as point of spear, and fromm, Frömmigkeit, from promos, what leads, l’avant-garde)
OH.linkedContent: advanced point is at once beginning and end, divided as beginning and end (Heidegger on Ort as point of spear, and fromm, Frömmigkeit, from promos, what leads, l’avant-garde)

SW.content: veil given by God, and giving here is ordering (donner c’est ici ordonner)
SW.linkedContent: veil given by God, and giving here is ordering (donner c’est ici ordonner)

SW.content: c’est un don qu’ils ordonnent [re: regulations of tallith]
SW.linkedContent: c’est un don qu’ils ordonnent [re: regulations of tallith]

CHM.content: Foucault’s Decision (re: point where madness & reason were split): both a fiat/decree/order & schism/dissension/caesura > this dissension is internal (cleavage, torment, w/in act of sentire), fission that divides it along lines of Hegelian Entzweiung [rupture, diremption]
CHM.linkedContent: Foucault’s Decision (re: point where madness & reason were split): both a fiat/decree/order & schism/dissension/caesura > this dissension is internal (cleavage, torment, w/in act of sentire), fission that divides it along lines of Hegelian Entzweiung [rupture, diremption]

TB.content: sacred text is transferability making its translation untranslatable
sacred text (absolute text): pas de sens (not poverty of meaning, but no meaning that would be itself) > sacred text surrenders itself to translation; commands right away the translation it refuses
TB.linkedContent: sacred text (absolute text): pas de sens (not poverty of meaning, but no meaning that would be itself) > sacred text surrenders itself to translation; commands right away the translation it refuses

TR.content: concept of “machine” indissociable from deconstruction: “a text whose grammaticality is a logical code obeys a machine” > no text w/out grammar, w/out machine, w/out “suspension of referential meaning”
TR.linkedContent: concept of “machine” indissociable from deconstruction: “a text whose grammaticality is a logical code obeys a machine” > no text w/out grammar, w/out machine, w/out “suspension of referential meaning”

PSSS.content: Kant (said this better than anyone): no right w/out coercion
PSSS.linkedContent: Kant (said this better than anyone): no right w/out coercion

PSSS.content: juridical decision approaches ideal of justice to extent that the community has at its disposal force of constraint to command respect for its ideal
PSSS.linkedContent: juridical decision approaches ideal of justice to extent that the community has at its disposal force of constraint to command respect for its ideal

PSSS.content: imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom
PSSS.linkedContent: imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom

TN.content: il y a la (là) du tact > given as given as much as ordered (do touch but avoid contact)
TN.linkedContent: il y a la (là) du tact > given as given as much as ordered (do touch but avoid contact)

TN.content: philosophy under thumb of finger and eye
TN.linkedContent: philosophy under thumb of finger and eye

TN.content: order of presences via haptical (if it was a finger point, command)
TN.linkedContent: order of presences via haptical (if it was a finger point, command)

ATM.content: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night
ATM.linkedContent: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night

ATM.content: what to make of a signature [Levinas’] when “il aura obligé,” when Il signs in his place?
ATM.linkedContent: what to make of a signature [Levinas’] when “il aura obligé,” when Il signs in his place?

ATM.content: how does one hear “one must” in Derrida’s polysemic “l’oeuvre d’E.L. aura obligé”
ATM.linkedContent: how does one hear “one must” in Derrida’s polysemic “l’oeuvre d’E.L. aura obligé”

CIN.content: a desire, order, prayer or promise: “another voice, may it come soon now, again, another voice…”
CIN.linkedContent: a desire, order, prayer or promise: “another voice, may it come soon now, again, another voice…”

BSi.content: à pas de loup (wolf), à pas de colombe (dove) (silent commands order world); wolf, war (hunting), dove, order, peace > both silent
BSi.linkedContent: à pas de loup (wolf), à pas de colombe (dove) (silent commands order world); wolf, war (hunting), dove, order, peace > both silent

BSi.content: obey what protects (double meaning of obliger) > when state says, “I protect you,” it institutes a fear that obliges you, subjects you [Donald Trump]
BSi.linkedContent: obey what protects (double meaning of obliger) > when state says, “I protect you,” it institutes a fear that obliges you, subjects you [Donald Trump]

BSi.content: [re: “Snake”] sovereign as guest (hôte) commands, the first comer, comes before me
BSi.linkedContent: [re: “Snake”] sovereign as guest (hôte) commands, the first comer, comes before me

BSi.content: threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself
BSi.linkedContent: threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself

OG.content: interior holy voice of faith; natural law, native unity of voice & writing is prescriptive, commandment > good writing comprehended as that which had to be comprehended
OG.linkedContent: interior holy voice of faith; natural law, native unity of voice & writing is prescriptive, commandment > good writing comprehended as that which had to be comprehended

OG.content: factum of phonetic writing commands our entire culture/science, not one fact among others > still, does not respond to a necessity of an absolute/universal essence
OG.linkedContent: factum of phonetic writing commands our entire culture/science, not one fact among others > still, does not respond to a necessity of an absolute/universal essence

EU.content: via Kant, government must arrest its own power in face of freedom (Montesquieu) > philosophy as absolute freedom but can’t give orders (who could be trained to inspect this?)
EU.linkedContent: via Kant, government must arrest its own power in face of freedom (Montesquieu) > philosophy as absolute freedom but can’t give orders (who could be trained to inspect this?)
